sk.stuba.fiit.perconik.core.services.listeners

Interface ListenerManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Manager, Nameable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DebugListenerManager
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractListenerManager, DebugListenerManagerProxy, ForwardingListenerManager

    public interface ListenerManager
extends Manager
    An object responsible for managing registrations of Listener instances.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pavol Zbell

        getName

    • Method Detail

      • register

        <L extends Listener> void register(L listener)
        Registers a listener to all compatible resources. Listener unregistration hooks are properly invoked during the unregistration process.

        Note that this method propagates any exception thrown by the specified listener as a cause of a ListenerRegistrationException instance.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be registered, not null
        Throws:
        ListenerAlreadyRegistredException - if the specified listener is already registered and this listener manager panics
        ListenerRegistrationException - if an exception is thrown by the specified listener during the unregistration process
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified listener is null

      • unregister

        <L extends Listener> void unregister(L listener)
        Unregisters a listener from all compatible resources. Listener unregistration hooks are properly invoked during the unregistration process.

        Note that this method propagates any exception thrown by the specified listener as a cause of a ListenerUnregistrationException instance.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be unregistered, not null
        Throws:
        ListenerNotRegistredException - if the specified listener is not registered and this listener manager panics
        ListenerUnregistrationException - if an exception is thrown by the specified listener during the registration process
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified listener is null

      • unregisterAll

        <L extends Listener> void unregisterAll(java.lang.Class<L> type)
        Unregisters all listeners assignable to the specified listener type from all compatible resources. A listener is assignable to a listener type if it is an instance of that type. Listener unregistration hooks are properly invoked for all matched listeners during the unregistration process.

        Note that this method collects all exceptions thrown by listeners during the unregistration process and propagates them as suppressed exceptions of a ListenerUnregistrationException instance.

        Parameters:
        type - the listener type to which the assignable listeners are going be unregistered, not null
        Throws:
        ListenerUnregistrationException - if an exception is thrown by one or more listeners during the unregistration process
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified listener type is null

      • registrations

        com.google.common.collect.SetMultimap<Resource<?>,Listener> registrations()
        Returns a set multimap of resources to all registered listeners.

      • registered

        <U extends Listener> java.util.Collection<U> registered(java.lang.Class<U> type)
        Returns all registered listeners assignable to the specified listener type from all compatible resources. A listener is assignable to a listener type if it is an instance of that type.
        Parameters:
        type - the listener type of the registered listeners, not null
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified listener type is null

      • registered

        boolean registered(Listener listener)
        Determines whether the specified listener is registered to all compatible resources.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be checked, not null
        Returns:
        true if the specified listener is registered to all compatible resources, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified listener is null

      • equals

        boolean equals(@Nullable
             java.lang.Object o)
        Compares the specified object with this manager for equality. Returns true if the specified object is also manager and the two managers have the same name. This definition ensures that this method works properly across different implementations of the manager interface.
        Specified by:
        equals in interface Manager
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - an object to be compared for equality with this manager
        Returns:
        true if the specified object is equal to this manager, false otherwise

      • hashCode

        int hashCode()
        Returns the hash code value for this manager. The hash code of a manager should be equivalent to the hash code of the manager's name.
        Specified by:
        hashCode in interface Manager
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the hash code value for this manager
